heroIntro:
Welcome to your ideal family home in Lo Romero Golf, Pilar de La Horadada. This exceptional 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa offers 127m² of thoughtfully designed living space on a generous 302m² plot—giving your family room to grow and play. Priced at €484,900, this property represents outstanding value, costing 40% less per square meter than comparable properties on Spanish islands, while maintaining premium specification throughout.

Located in one of the Costa Blanca's most family-friendly neighborhoods, this villa combines modern comfort with the practical features families need: secure gated community living, proximity to international schools, safe tree-lined streets, and quick access to healthcare, supermarkets, and beautiful beaches. The established expat community means excellent English-language support for settling in, from schools to medical services.

Whether you're relocating from the UK, Northern Europe, or elsewhere, this property provides the space, safety, and convenience families seek when establishing their Spanish home base.
areaSection: Pilar de La Horadada is a charming coastal town in southern Alicante, positioned perfectly between Murcia and the glittering beaches of Costa Blanca. The town straddles the border with Murcia, creating a unique dual-community atmosphere. Known for its authentic Spanish character combined with strong international presence, Pilar de La Horadada offers genuine Mediterranean living without the overdevelopment of larger resorts. The climate is exceptional year-round: mild winters (rarely below 10°C) and warm, dry summers make outdoor living possible throughout the year. The town maintains its fishing village heritage while steadily developing modern amenities, shopping centers, and family facilities. Its strategic location puts you 50 minutes from Alicante Airport, 40 minutes from Murcia's beaches, and nestled within one of Spain's most respected golf communities.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Pilar de La Horadada revolves around family, community, and the relaxed Mediterranean pace. School runs are easy—international schools are well-established here with British curriculum options widely available. After school, children can enjoy safe neighborhood play, weekly markets bursting with fresh produce, and beach trips just 20 minutes away. Healthcare access is straightforward: multiple supermarkets (Mercadona, Lidl, Consum) are within minutes, and English-speaking medical professionals operate in both public and private clinics. The expat community is mature and welcoming, with established social networks, support groups, and English-language services making integration smooth. Weekends often include golf outings at championship courses, beach days at Blue Flag beaches, or exploring local tapas restaurants where English is increasingly spoken. The cost of living is notably lower than northern Spain or the islands, stretching your family budget further while maintaining quality of life.
investmentSection: This property represents intelligent investment in a appreciating market. Pilar de La Horadada property values have increased 8% year-on-year, outperforming many Costa Blanca towns. At €3,818/m², this villa commands a premium above the local average of €2,200/m², justified by its modern construction and Lo Romero Golf location. Rental potential is strong: similar 3-bedroom villas achieve €800+ per week during peak season, generating €40,000+ annually. Long-term appreciation is supported by infrastructure improvements, growing international school presence, and increasing demand for coastal family homes. The 40% cost advantage compared to Spanish island markets (Balearics, Canaries) makes this compelling for investors seeking yield and growth in a family-friendly location.

healthcare.text: Healthcare access in Pilar de La Horadada is excellent and reassuring for families. The Vega Baja regional hospital is within 30 minutes, offering comprehensive emergency and specialist services. Multiple private clinics operate throughout the town, many staffed with English-speaking doctors and nursing staff accustomed to international patients. Dental services, opticians, and pharmacies are abundant. Health centers in town provide GP-level care, and many doctors speak English fluently. The Spanish healthcare system is highly regarded, and international residents can access both public and private options.

faqs.question: Hur mycket kostar denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: €484,900. This 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa offers exceptional value at €3,818 per square meter—40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands like Mallorca or Ibiza. Payment options include cash, Spanish mortgages (available to foreign buyers), and installment plans through some developers.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and EU citizens can purchase property in Spain with minimal restrictions. British, American, and other international buyers commonly own homes here. You'll need an NIE (tax identification number), which is straightforward to obtain. No visa is required specifically to buy property, though residency visa options exist separately.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (approximately 0.5-1%), land registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and real estate agent fees (typically 3-5%). Total closing costs usually total 8-13% of purchase price. This property's €484,900 price would involve approximately €38,800-€63,000 in additional costs, depending on funding method and professional services chosen.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment location. The region experiences consistent 6-10% annual appreciation, offers strong rental yields (€800+/week for 3-bedroom villas), provides exceptional year-round climate, and attracts stable international demand. Pilar de La Horadada specifically has appreciated 8% year-on-year and offers particularly good value compared to developed coastal towns.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes, most major Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically up to 80% of property value. You'll need an NIE, proof of income, and financial documentation. Interest rates are competitive (currently 3-4%). Some international mortgage brokers specialize in Spanish properties for UK and Northern European buyers, simplifying the process.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Pilar de La Horadada is notably lower than the UK or Northern Europe. Supermarket shopping costs 20-30% less, utilities run €100-150/month, and eating out at local restaurants costs €10-15 per person. Healthcare is affordable (€300-500/year for private health insurance), and property taxes are modest. A family of four typically budgets €1,200-1,800/month for comfortable living, excluding mortgage.

faqs.question: Are international schools available in Pilar de La Horadada?
faqs.answer: Yes, several international schools with British, American, and other curricula operate in the area, most within 10-15 minutes. These schools are well-established, offering familiar educational systems and strong expat community networks. Many offer morning pickup and after-school programs, making them practical for working families.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, 48 minutes from Pilar de La Horadada, connects directly to most UK airports with multiple daily flights. Flight times are typically 2-2.5 hours. Budget airlines (Ryanair, EasyJet) offer frequent affordable routes, making UK visits convenient and regular travel practical.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate: mild winters (10-15°C average), warm summers (28-32°C), and 300+ days of annual sunshine. Rain is minimal (200-300mm yearly). This climate enables outdoor living nearly year-round—beach swimming is comfortable April through October, and even winter months are pleasant for coastal walks and outdoor activities.

faqs.question: What makes Lo Romero Golf special for families?
faqs.answer: Lo Romero Golf is a gated, secure community specifically designed for family living. It features championship golf courses, safe tree-lined streets for children, established community events and social networks, excellent infrastructure, and proximity to schools and amenities. The community atmosphere attracts families and successful professionals seeking both safety and active lifestyle.
